A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: If you're looking for answers to the burning questions from TFA\, don't hold your breath. And the couple of answers you do get are pretty disappointing. I didn't hate this movie\, there were some great scenes\, dialogue and action\, but then there were also a lot of pointless scenes which served no purpose and a couple of baffling demises. Can't understand why they would hype up a couple of characters SO much in TFA only to have them fizzle in TLJ so easily. Luke is a legend\, but he was treated abysmally in this movie. Not the return to the big screen he deserved. They have 3 different writers on this trilogy - so I suppose how can there be any seamlessness and cohesion and when they all have a different vision?
